title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Zero potential energy can be defined at any point. For convenience define it to be at the equilibrium point of the hanging object. The graph above uses this definition

Then E=U+K= 1 2 m v 2 max ,so U= 1 2 m v 2 max −K= 1 2 m v 2 max − 1 2 m [ v( t ) ] 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGfb Gaeyypa0JaamyvaiabgUcaRiaadUeacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaaigda aeaacaaIYaaaaiaad2gacaWG2bWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaOWaaS baaSqaaiGac2gacaGGHbGaaiiEaaqabaGccaGGSaGaam4Caiaad+ga aeaacaWGvbGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaaaacaWGTb GaamODamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakmaaBaaaleaaciGGTbGaaiyy aiaacIhaaeqaaOGaeyOeI0Iaam4saiabg2da9maalaaabaGaaGymaa qaaiaaikdaaaGaamyBaiaadAhadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaGcdaWg aaWcbaGaciyBaiaacggacaGG4baabeaakiabgkHiTmaalaaabaGaaG ymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGaamyBamaadmaabaGaamODamaabmaabaGaamiD aaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaGaay5waiaaw2faamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaa aaaaaa@62AF@

The amplitude of the velocity graph is approximately 1.6 m/s, and the period is 1 s. So v(t)=(1.6m/s)sin(2πt/1s). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B25@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a graph that is either a sine or cosine curve

1 point is earned for a graph that has the appropriate phase relationship to the given position and velocity graphs

a max = F max /m=k x max /m MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGHb WaaSbaaSqaaiGac2gacaGGHbGaaiiEaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWGgbWa aSbaaSqaaiGac2gacaGGHbGaaiiEaaqabaGccaGGVaGaamyBaiabg2 da9iaadUgacaWG4bWaaSbaaSqaaiGac2gacaGGHbGaaiiEaaqabaGc caGGVaGaamyBaaqaaaaaaa@480F@

The spring constant k can be determined using the period.

T=2π m/k ,so,k=4 π 2 m/ T 2 =4 π 2 ( 0.125kg )/ ( 1s ) 2 =0.5 π 2 kg/ s 2 a=( 0.5 π 2 kg )( 0.25m )/0.125kg=9.87m/ s 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGub Gaeyypa0JaaGOmaiabec8aWnaakaaabaGaamyBaiaac+cacaWGRbaa leqaaOGaaiilaiaadohacaWGVbGaaiilaiaadUgacqGH9aqpcaaI0a GaeqiWda3aaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaOGaamyBaiaac+cacaWGubWa aWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaOGaeyypa0JaaGinaiabec8aWnaaCaaale qabaGaaGOmaaaakmaabmaabaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaa iwdacaWGRbGaam4zaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaac+cadaqadaqaaiaaig dacaWGZbaacaGLOaGaayzkaaWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaOGaeyyp a0JaaGimaiaac6cacaaI1aGaeqiWda3aaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaO Gaam4AaiaadEgacaGGVaGaam4CamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaOqa aiaadggacqGH9aqpdaqadaqaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGynaiabec8aWn aaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiaadUgacaWGNbaacaGLOaGaayzkaaWa aeWaaeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaikdacaaI1aGaamyBaaGaayjkaiaawM caaiaac+cacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaaIYaGaaGynaiaadUgacaWG NbGaeyypa0JaaGyoaiaac6cacaaI4aGaaG4naiaad2gacaGGVaGaam 4CamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaaaa@812B@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a reasonable experimental setup that would allow useful measurements

1 point is earned for indicating all measurements needed and no extraneous ones

1 point is earned for evidence that multiple trials are performed

For example: Hook the rubber band over a horizontal rod, and measure its length. Hang an object of known mass from it and measure the new length. Repeat for a number of different objects.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for a reasonable experimental setup that would allow useful measurements

1 point is earned for indicating all measurements needed and no extraneous ones

1 point is earned for evidence that multiple trials are performed

For example: Hook the rubber band over a horizontal rod, and measure its length. Hang an object of known mass from it and measure the new length. Repeat for a number of different objects.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for a reasonable experimental setup that would allow useful measurements

1 point is earned for indicating all measurements needed and no extraneous ones

1 point is earned for evidence that multiple trials are performed

For example: Hook the rubber band over a horizontal rod, and measure its length. Hang an object of known mass from it and measure the new length. Repeat for a number of different objects.

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned for a reasonable experimental setup that would allow useful measurements

1 point is earned for indicating all measurements needed and no extraneous ones

1 point is earned for evidence that multiple trials are performed

For example: Hook the rubber band over a horizontal rod, and measure its length. Hang an object of known mass from it and measure the new length. Repeat for a number of different objects.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for a reasonable experimental setup that would allow useful measurements

1 point is earned for indicating all measurements needed and no extraneous ones

1 point is earned for evidence that multiple trials are performed

For example: Hook the rubber band over a horizontal rod, and measure its length. Hang an object of known mass from it and measure the new length. Repeat for a number of different objects.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for an appropriate analysis that would check for a linear relationship between force and rubber band stretch

1 point is earned for indicating an appropriate characteristic from the analysis that signifies a linear relationship

1 point is earned for indicating that a linear graph means that the rubber band exhibits F ∝ x like an ideal spring

For example: Plot the rubber band stretch as a function of the mass of the objects. A linear graph would show that the stretch and the force exerted on the rubber band (i.e. the weight of the object) are directly proportional, as they are for a spring
